question: So do young people take their parents advice when choosing a major?
transcript: In my country, there are a lot of young people who, take advice from their parents And I think that is the end of the video. I think that you cannot be able to take the parents when choosing a major as well as let their parents choose their major for them. I do not think this is a good trend. So, I think in the future young people should be more independent and choose their own major. Alright, so I think that is the end of all speaking tests today.

anti_overrating.reason: Includes meta talk ('that is the end of the video'). 'cannot be able to take the parents' (should not rely on parents?).

question: Describe a place in your city or town where you like to go to in your free time.
transcript: there is this huge shopping mall right in the western part of my city called, Bombland. I really like there and it has a great number of, stores, of all kinds. I usually go there in my leisure time with my sister and, I enjoy, window shopping there, I do not have a lot of time to do shopping there although there are so many other things to do. so, people can go there to do their shopping, spend time together and just have fun in their leisure time. Wonderful.

anti_overrating.reason: 'I really like there' (I really like it there).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: And why do you like to go there in particular?
transcript: I think it is because there are so many different activities that you can do there.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Uses a mix of simple and complex sentence forms.

question: Whatever I need to buy I can find it there.
transcript: Or if I want to get together with my friends, it is a great place for us to hang out for a while. in a, summary, to just, have a conclusion, I can say that it is like a, little city under one roof. it is amazing.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: And is there anything you do not like about it?
transcript: Yes, the only thing that I can think of is the parking situation. The parking garage is, so crowded and sometimes I have to spend, a lot of time just driving around to find an empty spot. besides I have just obtained my driving license and so it is kind of annoying and it annoys me even more. So I think that they should have a system to show us where the empty spots are so that we can just go right to the spots without dragging around and around for a long time.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: And is it a popular place for people in your city?
transcript: Absolutely yes. it is a well-known place among Iranians, especially people who live in Tehran. I think one of the reasons is, because, you can do, many different activities there, as I mentioned before. and there are so many things that you can purchase. The other reason, that I can think of is that you can find whatever you need, and, people can buy, different stuff, needless to go anywhere else afterwards. Wonderful.

anti_overrating.reason: 'needless to go' (without needing to go / no need to go).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: How often do you use the internet?
transcript: To be honest, I am almost always online since my work and my studies both can be undertaken through the internet. Especially since, this coronavirus situation happened, we do not have any other choice than to use the internet. I usually use, internet to, find information both for my work and some personal reasons. So, I am, I can say that I am, using internet several times a day. Wow.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: And do you like shopping online?
transcript: I am a huge fan of online shopping. because, it is so easy and, you just, it is kind of my thing. I can say that, say it that way. the shipping costs are, kind of high, but, it is worth it and I really enjoy searching the net and finding information before I make a big purchase that is one of the big benefits that online shopping has Okay, thank you very much. All right. Now I am going to give you a topic and I would like you to talk about it for up to two minutes.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: And are there any hobbies that you think are not worthwhile?
transcript: To be honest, some hobbies can be a real waste of time for me. for example, collecting baseball cards, is, not, one of my favorites because I am so uninterested in baseball. But, of course, I cannot say that it cannot be worthwhile for, someone who enjoys, baseball and likes this hobby. So I think that having a hobby is fine as long as it is not harmful to yourself and other people. And as long as you are having fun with it, so it is okay and it is worth doing it.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Okay, and why do you think people have hobbies?
transcript: I think people, have different entertainments, in their free time because they want to relax. After a whole week of working or studying, we all need some time to relax and enjoy ourselves. Also, people might have hobbies to learn some new skills like drawing, like knitting, or even learning a new language. And the other thing that I can think of is finding new people and new friends. You can join groups of like-minded people, that have the same hobbies as you do and that can be so great and fun. so I think, these are the reasons why people allocate time to hobbies.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: And how important is it to encourage children to take up hobbies?
transcript: It is great. I think it is so good to motivate, children to, take up hobbies for themselves. that is how, they can, Use their free time instead of just wandering around, watching TV, or just playing with their phones. It can be great, it can be a good experience, and they can learn some new skills too. I mean, even if their hobby is to just draw something simple, they can learn some useful skills too. Like organizing, like setting up their mind, like choosing a goal and reaching it. So I think it can be useful in their daily life too.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Are there any questions you would like to ask me?
transcript: Actually I was just worried about the time managing and, that is one of the reasons why I was trying to talk as much as I can, as fast as I can. And, yeah, it was a, great, feedback for me to just slow down a little bit and concentrate more. Nice, my pleasure.
